intro: Lobivia janseniana, commonly known as the Jansen's lobivia, is a species of flowering plant in the cactus family, Cactaceae. It is native to the arid regions of South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. This succulent plant is characterized by its cylindrical stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it well-suited for rocky or sandy environments. Lobivia janseniana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
